page.title: 11WATER IN POLWARTH
page.content: POLWARTH IS WELL WATERED. FLOURISHWALLS BURN & RUMBLINGSTONE BURN BOTH RUN INTO THE SWARDEN (NOTED FOR ITS TROUT & THEIR GUDDLEABILITY), WHICH RUNS INTO THE KIRK BURN THEN THE HOWE BURN, THE BLACKADDER, THE WHITEADDER & INTO THE TWEED. THERE MANY WELLS, AS THE BLACK WELL AT POLWARTH, & SPRINGS, SOME BEING FOUND WHEN BUILDING THE BIG BARN AT WOODHEADS IN 1983. MUCH DRAINAGE & CHANNELLING WAS DONE IN THE 18 CENTURY WNEN THE WATER SYSTEM FOR MARCHMONT WAS INSTALLED. THAT IS STILL SPRING WATER & NOT MAINS, SO THAT NO WATER RATES ARE PAID ON IT OR ANY OF THE ADJACENT HOUSES. THE WATER IS QUITE HARD & IS SAID TO BE GOOD FOR THE DIGESTION & THE TEETH OF GROWING CHILDREN.
